text: Hey do you ever feel as though you cannot express

your thoughts and feelings as clearly 
as you would in your native language?

I’ve found it is true for virtually 
every student I’ve ever had,

and I can sure say it has been true for me in 
every one of the six languages I’ve learned.

No matter how much time you’ve spent 
learning a language, being concerned

about how other people react when you speak 
can have a huge impact on your confidence.

Perhaps the fear of making a grammar mistake, 
misunderstanding, or mispronunciation is causing

you to miss out on precious opportunities.
So in today’s lesson, let’s look at 5 things we

can learn from Sofia Vergara and her incomparable 
character, Gloria, on the TV show Modern Family

about how you can overcome these fears and 
be a confident and natural English speaker.

But before we get started, if this is your 
first time joining us, welcome! Each week we

help millions of learners like you understand 
fast-speaking English without getting lost,

without missing the jokes and without subtitles. 
So join our global community! Simply hit the

subscribe button and the bell down below, and you 
will never miss out on any of our new lessons.

Earlier in this scene, Gloria became very upset 
because Jay had allowed Manny to take French

lessons when she would have prefered that he 
study their mother tongue, which is Spanish.

How about you? Have you ever experienced 
a situation where it was difficult to

express your thoughts in English? Share your 
experience with us in the comments below.

All right, so in this scene, Gloria and Luke 
have to find the Christmas angel ornaments.

However, Gloria is afraid to go into the 
attic because there might be spiders,
so Luke goes up to look for them.

It can sometimes feel like there are so 
many rules when it comes to pronunciation.

Using outdated, ineffective and boring 
methods to learn a language can only

make it feel more frustrating and hopeless.
This is why we created our Fluent with Friends

course, where we will guide you to understand 
native pronunciation, connected speech, as well

as the cultural context so that you can laugh 
along with every joke. What’s more, you can try

it for free right now with our 3 part masterclass! 
Simply click here or in the description below.

Now before we continue with our list 
of 5 things we can learn from Gloria,

let’s have a look at how connected 
speech is used in this scene.
